thread.title: Red Sox players salute Don Orsillo after his final game with team (Video) - Red Sox
thread.title_full: Red Sox players salute Don Orsillo after his final game with team (Video) - Red Sox

author: boston.com
title: Red Sox players salute Don Orsillo after his final game with team (Video) - Red Sox
text:
It isn’t just fans of the Red Sox who will miss Don Orsillo. The players showed appreciation, too.
Before Orsillo ended his 15-year tenure as the play-by-play voice of the Red Sox on NESN on Sunday, several players and coaches emerged from the dugout to salute him. The gesture came after the Red Sox’ season-ending loss to the Indians in Cleveland.
Your browser does not support iframes.
 “I thought that was something that we collectively thought would be a very nice gesture for Don,” said Red Sox interim manager Torey Lovullo, via MLB.com . “He means a lot to all of us in different ways, but he means so much to the community and to the Boston Red Sox, and we just wanted to acknowledge him for his hard work and all that dedication.”
The gesture did not go unnoticed by Orsillo.
“Unbelievably, I wave to the Red Sox for the final time. Thank you, boys,” he said as he waved back to the players and coaches who had emerged from the dugout.
“Orsillo rounding third and heading home.”
In a move unpopular with many Red Sox fans, NESN opted to replace Orsillo with veteran broadcaster Dave O’Brien in 2016. Instead of returning to Fenway Park next season, Orsillo will be heading west to join the San Diego Padres’ broadcast booth. The Padres announced on Sept. 30 that Orsillo had agreed to a multiyear deal.
Red Sox old friends—Former Sox on other teams
Previous -- of -- Next The Baltimore Orioles called up former Red Sox catcher Ryan Lavarnway from Triple-A Norfolk in April 2015. Lavarnway saw limited duty with Boston from 2011-2014. Barry Chin/Globe Staff Previous -- of -- Next Former Red Sox center fielder Jacoby Ellsbury joined the New York Yankees as a free agent in 2014. Ellsbury spent seven seasons with the Red Sox from 2007-2013. Getty Images/Elsa Previous -- of -- Next Former Red Sox reliever Andrew Miller signed with the Yankees before the start of the 2015 season. Miller spent 3-1/2 years with the Red Sox (2011-2014) before being traded to the Orioles in July 2014. Kathy Willens Previous -- of -- Next Former Red Sox infielder Stephen Drew has been with the Yankees since July 31, 2014, when the Red Sox traded him for infielder Kelly Johnson. Drew was with the Red Sox for two seasons (2013-2014). Getty Images/Elsa Previous -- of -- Next Former Red Sox first baseman James Loney has been with the Rays since signing with Tampa Bay as a free agent after the 2012 season. Loney played 30 games for the Red Sox after coming over from the Dodgers in 2012. AP Photo/O'Meara Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next Grady Sizemore played in 52 games for the Red Sox in 2014, batting .216/.288/.324 before being released by Boston. The outfielder signed with the Phillies as a free agent in 2014 and joined the Rays in minor-league deal in 2015 after Philadelphia released the former Indians star. STEVE NESIUS Previous -- of -- Next Former Red Sox shortstop Jose Iglesias has been with the Tigers since 2013 when Boston traded him away in a deal that yielded the Sox righthander Jake Peavy. Iglesia -- with the Sox from 2011-13 -- missed all of the 2014 season with shin injuries. AP Photo/Carlos Osorio Previous -- of -- Next Former Red Sox outfielder Yoenis Cespedes is now with the Detroit Tigers after the Red Sox traded him for righthander Rick Porcello after the 2014 season. Cespedes came to Boston from Oakland in 2014 in a deal that sent Jon Lester and Jonny Gomes to the A's. AP Photo/Carlos Osorio Previous -- of -- Next Former Red Sox catcher Victor Martinez signed with the Detroit Tigers as a free agent after the 2010 season. Martinez was traded by the Indians to the Red Sox in July 2009 in exchange for Justin Masterson and two other players. AP Photo/Carlos Osorio Previous -- of -- Next Former Red Sox reliever Scott Atchison joined the Indians in 2014 as a free agent. Atchison put up a 3.18 ERA with the Red Sox from 2010-1012. AP Photo/Patric Schneider Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next Former Red Sox outfielder Brandon Moss was traded to the Indians from the A's after the 2014 season. Moss hit .291 with the Red Sox from 2007-2008. AP Photo/Mark Duncan Previous -- of -- Next Former Red Sox infielder Mike Aviles has been with the Indians since the 2013 season. Aviles joined Boston in July 2011 before being sent to Toronto in a deal that brought John Farrell to Boston after the 2012 season. AP Photo/Matt Marton Previous -- of -- Next Former Red Sox outfielder David Murphy signed with the Indians as a free agent after the 2013 season. Murphy had 28 plate appearances for the Red Sox between 2006-2007. AP Photo/Jim Mone Previous -- of -- Next Former Red Sox relief pitcher Matt Albers (2011-2012: 3.81 ERA) signed as a free agent with the White Sox before the start of the 2015 season. AP Photo/Carlos Osorio Previous -- of -- Next Adam LaRoche had 19 plate appearances for the Red Sox in 2009 before being dealt to the Braves for Casey Kotchman. The 1B/DH signed with the White Sox as a free agent before the 2015 season. USA Today Sports/Rick Osentoski Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next Former Red Sox infielder Jed Lowrie is in his second tour of duty with the Astros, signing as a free agent with Houston after the 2014 season. Lowrie played four years in Boston (2008-11), batting .252 in 256 games. Getty Images/Bob Levey Previous -- of -- Next Josh Reddick batted.248/.290/.416 for the Red Sox from 2009-2011. The outfielder was traded to the Athletics after the 2011 season in exchange for Andrew Bailey and Ryan Sweeney. Getty Images/Bob Levey Previous -- of -- Next Coco Crisp batted .271/.330/.390 for the Red Sox from 2006-2008. The speedy outfielder was dealt to the Royals for Ramon Ramirez after the 2008 season. He's been with the A's for the last six seasons. Getty Images/Rick Yeatts Previous -- of -- Next Cody Ross hit 22 homers for the Red Sox during the last-place-finish 2012 season. The outfielder was released by the Athletics in May 2015. AP Photo/Marcio Jose Sanchez Previous -- of -- Next In May 2015, the Red Sox traded struggling reliever Edward Mujica to the Oakland Athletics for a player to be named later or cash. In 75 games with the Red Sox, Mujica went 3-5 with a 4.03 ERA and had 8 saves. LM Otero Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next Adrian Beltre had a monster year for the Red Sox in 2010, belting 28 homers with 102 RBIs. The third baseman signed as a free agent with the Rangers before the 2011 season. AP Photo/Brad Loper Previous -- of -- Next A.J. Pierzynski batted .254 for the Red Sox in 2014 before being released in July. The catcher signed as a free agent with the Braves before the start of the 2015 season. AP/Aaron Vincent Elkaim, The Canadian Press Previous -- of -- Next Jonny Gomes had 19 homers in his two seasons (2013-14) with the Red Sox before he was dealt to Oakland in the Jon Lester trade. The outfielder signed with the Braves as a free agent in 2015. Getty Images/Tom Szczerbowski Previous -- of -- Next Pedro Ciriaco had 330 plate appearances for the Red Sox in 2012-13, batting .281/.311/.384. He signed with the Braves as a free agent after the 2014 season. Daniel Shirey Previous -- of -- Next Kelly Johnson had 25 plate appearances for the Red Sox in 2014 after coming over from the Yankees in exchange for Stephen Drew. The infielder signed with the Braves as a free agent in 2015. Getty Images/Tom Szczerbowski Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next Bartolo Colon went 4-2 for the Red Sox in 2008. The righthander signed with the New York Mets, his eighth MLB team, before the 2014 season. Getty Images/Al Bello Previous -- of -- Next Jonathan Papelbon saved 219 games in seven years with the Red Sox (2005-2011). The righthanded closer signed with the Phillies as a free agent before the 2012 season. AP Photo/Billy Hurst Previous -- of -- Next Jon Lester went 110-63 in nine years with the Red Sox (2006-14), including going 3-0 with a 0.43 ERA in three World Series games. Lester was traded to the Oakland A’s in 2014, and signed with the Chicago Cubs before the 2015 season. AP Photo/Paul Beaty Previous -- of -- Next David Ross batted .195/.271/.366 as backup catcher for the Red Sox in three seasons (2008, 2013-14). He signed as a free agent with the Cubs before the 2015 season. AP Photo/Nam Y. Huh Previous -- of -- Next Marlon Byrd had 100 at-bats for the Red Sox in 2012, batting .270/.286/.320. The outfielder was traded by the Phillies to the Reds before the 2015 season. Getty Images/David Banks Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next Mark Melancon appeared in 41 games for the Red Sox in 2012, going 0-2 with a 6.20 ERA. The reliever was traded to the Pirates after the 2011 season in a deal that brought Joel Hanrahan and Brock Holt to Boston. AP Photo/Ross D. Franklin Previous -- of -- Next John Lackey went 47-43 for the Red Sox from 2010-13. The righthander -- who won Boston’s clinching Game 6 of the 2013 World Series -- was traded to the Cardinals in 2014 for Allen Craig and Joe Kelly. AP Photo/Nick Wass Previous -- of -- Next Rubby De La Rosa went 4-10 for the Red Sox from 2013-14. The righthander was traded to the Arizona Diamondbacks along with Allen Webster in exchange for Wade Miley. AP Photo/Ross D. Franklin Previous -- of -- Next Jarrod Saltalamacchia batted .243/.307/.455 in four seasons with the Red Sox from 2010-13. The catcher signed with the Marlins in 2013 and was released by Miami in May of 2015 and signed by the Arizona Diamondbacks. David Zalubowski Previous -- of -- Next Bronson Arroyo went 24-19 in three seasons with the Red Sox (2003-2005). The righthander was traded to the Reds in 2006 in exchange for Wily Mo Pena. He signed with the Arizona Diampondbacks in 2014. AP Photo/Jayne Kamin-Oncea Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next Adrian Gonzalez hit .321/.382/.513 in two years with the Red Sox (2011-12). The first baseman was traded to the Dodgers in 2012 in a deal that brought James Loney, Allen Webster, Rubby de la Rosa, and Ivan De Jesus to Boston. Getty Images/Stephen Dunn Previous -- of -- Next In two years with the Red Sox (2011-12), Carl Crawford hit .260/.292/.419 while battling injuries. The outfielder was dealt to the Dodgers along with Josh Beckett, Adrian Gonzalez, and Nick Punto in August 2012. AP Photo/Mark J. Terrill Previous -- of -- Next Will Middlebrooks batted .237/.284/.411 in his three years in Boston where his production never matched his potential. The third baseman was traded to the Padres after the 2014 season in exchange for catcher Ryan Hanigan. AP Photo/Lenny Ignelzi Previous -- of -- Next Jake Peavy went 5-10 with a 4.48 ERA in his two years with the Red Sox. The righthanded starter was traded to the Giants in July 2014 in exchange for minor-league pitchers Edwin Escobar and Heath Hembree. AP Photo/Tannen Maury
